title: Chinese Government provides $1 million loan for improvement of waste water treatment system of Samarkand (Linked to Project ID#54507)
description: In 2008, the Chinese Government provided a $1 million loan to the Government of Uzbekistan for the improvement of the wastewater treatment system of Samarkand. The total investment for the project was $1.1 million. The treatment plant's reconstruction was completed at the end of 2017 after starting in 2009.
staff_comments: 1. This project is recorded in a 2008 IMF report, but loan may have been issued before 2008. This issue warrants further investigation.2. This project is linked to a similar project in Bukhara (captured via Project ID#54507).
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1 million loan for improvement of waste water treatment system of Samarkand (Linked to Project ID#54507)

# Description
In 2008, the Chinese Government provided a $1 million loan to the Government of Uzbekistan for the improvement of the wastewater treatment system of Samarkand. The total investment for the project was $1.1 million. The treatment plant's reconstruction was completed at the end of 2017 after starting in 2009.
justification: Project focuses on wastewater treatment system improvement, which is unrelated to energy transition goals
evidence: Wastewater treatment system improvement, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $1 million loan for improvement of waste water treatment system of Bukhara (Linked to Project ID#54506)
description: In 2008, the Chinese Government provided a $1 million loan to the Government of Uzbekistan for the improvement of the wastewater treatment system of Samarkand. The total investment for the project was $1.1 million. The project was approved on August 4, 2009 with construction starting on September 30, 2013. The project was completed on November 30, 2021.
staff_comments: 1. This project is recorded in a 2008 IMF report, but loan may have been issued before 2008. This issue warrants further investigation.2. This project is linked to a similar commitment in Samarkand (as captured via Project ID#54506)

evidence: Wastewater treatment system improvement, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Government loans $19.1 million for reconstruction of the water intake facility WF-1, WF-3 in Tashkent oblast
description: In 2008, China provided a $19.1 million government loan in 2008 for reconstruction of the water intake facility WF-1, WF-3 for water supply to the rural population of Chinaz, and part of Yangy-Uyl rayon of Tashkent oblast. Current project status and loan details are unknown.
staff_comments: Project reported in 2008 Uzbekistan IMF report, but exact commitment year is uncertain. Project could not be confirmed with any additional sources.

title: China Eximbank provides $8.8 million loan for rehabilitation of the pump station 'Ulugnar' in Andijan oblast
description: In 2008, China Eximbank provided an $8.8 million loan to the Government of Uzbekistan for a pumping station located in the Ulugnar district within the Andijan oblast. This project was reportedly completed in 2010. China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation.
staff_comments: Project was recorded in the 2008 IMF report but loan could have been committed earlier, so year is marked uncertain.

title: China Eximbank provides $6 million loan for rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast
description: On October 2, 2008, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5,759,830 loan agreement for the rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast. The loan carried the following terms: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. The National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan use the proceeds of this loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at a 2.2% interest rate.  China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. This project was reportedly completed in 2010.
staff_comments: 1. The Russian name of this project is  «Реконструкция насосной станции «Гульбахор 1К».
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Eximbank provides $6 million loan for rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast

# Description
On October 2, 2008, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $5,759,830 loan agreement for the rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station in Andijan oblast. The loan carried the following terms: 20 year maturity, 5 year grace period. 2% interest rate, 0.3% commitment fee, and 0.3% management fee. The National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan use the proceeds of this loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at a 2.2% interest rate.  China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. This project was reportedly completed in 2010.
justification: Project focuses on water supply infrastructure rehabilitation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Rehabilitation of Gulbakhor pumping station, water supply and sanitation sector

title: China Eximbank provides $2.1 million loan for rehabilitation of the Raish Khakent-1 pumping station in Andijan oblast (linked to #72138)
description: On September 12, 2008, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $2.1 million loan agreement for the rehabilitation Raish Khakent-1 (or RaishKhakent-1) pumping station located within the Andijan oblast. This loan carried the following terms: 15 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 3% interest rate, 0.3% management fee, and 0.3% commitment. National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan use the proceeds of this loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at a 3.2% interest rate.  China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. According to the President's office source, the project had a set completion date of October 1, 2010. This project was reportedly completed in 2010.  This project is linked to a loan for Raish Khakent-2 in 2014 (captured in #72138).
staff_comments: The Russian project title is Реконструкция насосной станции «Раиш-Хакент-1» в Андижанской области.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Eximbank provides $2.1 million loan for rehabilitation of the Raish Khakent-1 pumping station in Andijan oblast (linked to #72138)

# Description
On September 12, 2008, China Eximbank and the National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan signed a $2.1 million loan agreement for the rehabilitation Raish Khakent-1 (or RaishKhakent-1) pumping station located within the Andijan oblast. This loan carried the following terms: 15 year maturity, 5 year grace period, 3% interest rate, 0.3% management fee, and 0.3% commitment. National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity of Uzbekistan use the proceeds of this loan to on-lend to an unidentified entity at a 3.2% interest rate.  China National Electric Equipment Corporation (CNEEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. According to the President's office source, the project had a set completion date of October 1, 2010. This project was reportedly completed in 2010.  This project is linked to a loan for Raish Khakent-2 in 2014 (captured in #72138).
justification: Project focuses on water supply infrastructure rehabilitation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Rehabilitation of pumping station, water supply and sanitation sector
